./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0019-00.wa: Each chapter begins with ten theme-related questions that were disclosed during the research.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0019-01.wa: Then we provide brief information about the theme.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0019-02.wa: Next is a short synopsis of the movie, including cautions about language, violence, drugs, alcohol, and sex to help you decide whether it is suitable for your family.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0019-03.wa: Based on the movie, we suggest questions for both you and your young person that will trigger ideas for a fruitful conversation.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0020-00.wa: There is also space for your child to write his own questions.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0020-01.wa: These questions and their answers might help you understand where your child is confused or how he is feeling about something.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0020-02.wa: The idea is to provide you and your child with topics and specific questions to ignite a dialogue that will build a firm structure that can help keep you close.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0021-00.wa: For those chapters where two movies are listed, you can decide which movie is most relevant to your child and your family situation.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0021-02.wa: Even if you are no longer in a relationship with that other parent, we think it's important for kids to be able to talk about the early years of their parents relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0021-03.wa: For those of you who are divorced, we offer a second movie choice in that same chapter to facilitate sensitive and honest discussion about marital conflict and dissolution.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0022-01.wa: One of the movies would be most appropriate to watch and discuss with a son, while the other is most suitable for a daughter.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0023-00.wa: In addition to one or two movies addressing the major themes, we have provided additional activities.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0023-01.wa: These are simple ideas that don't take a lot of preparation or time, but your willingness to participate in them can help to elicit even more meaningful conversations.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0024-00.wa: Sometimes a child doesn't know what questions she has.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0024-01.wa: For that reason, we've included an appendix listing four hundred fifty questions revealed in the research.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0024-04.wa: Is this something you're curious about?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0024-05.wa: This could be fun during carpool time, on long road trips together, or at the family dinner table.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0025-00.wa: You can use this book in a variety of ways.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0025-02.wa: Throughout the next month, you can bring up the topics or invite questions suggested within that chapter while eating meals or driving, or you can initiate some of the other activities we suggest.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0026-01.wa: That is, you can select a particular theme when something occurs that makes it relevant to your family experience of the moment.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0027-01.wa: This has the added advantage of cueing you in to what issues might be pressing for him at this moment.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0028-00.wa: Another creative way to use this book is to organize a monthly movie club with a group of other parents and preteens.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0028-02.wa: You can make a game out of it, rolling dice to decide who picks the first question out of a hat or who has to answer a question.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0030-01.wa: We hope What Kids REALLY Want to Ask will increase that tally by the number of young people you care about.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0031-00.wa: Cultivate a support system for yourself.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0031-01.wa: Parenting is the hardest job there is.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0031-03.wa: Especially helpful is a nonjudgmental partner or friend who will let you vent about your teen when you are angry or frustrated.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0031-04.wa: It is helpful to have someone who can remember that both you and your child are good people struggling to grow and learn, despite whatever conflict might be happening.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0032-00.wa: What Kids REALLY Want to Ask is a book designed to establish a level playing field on which parents and preteens can have meaningful conversations.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0032-01.wa: The inherent power differential between parents and kids often gets in the way of honest and open communication.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0032-02.wa: Work at eliminating criticism and judgments when using the suggestions in this book.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0032-04.wa: I will respect and take seriously any question you have.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0032-05.wa: Your actions speak louder than words on this one.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0032-06.wa: If you say you are open to any question but then indicate by your body language or your response that you don't mean it, it will be hard to regain your child's trust.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0034-00.wa: Try not to have any particular agenda.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0034-02.wa: Let the talk flow wherever it may.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0034-03.wa: Take your cues from your child.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0035-00.wa: Let your child lead the conversation as much as possible.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0035-01.wa: If she doesn't have anything to say, don't push it.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0035-02.wa: Just make it clear you're open to talking about anything brought up by the movies, the activities, or the questions in the back of the book.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0035-03.wa: Chances are she'll think it over and get back to you at a later time with anything that's on her mind.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0036-00.wa: When your preteen is talking, concentrate on listening, not on evaluating or judging what he says.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0036-01.wa: As parents, we often feel we need to be imparting wisdom constantly.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0036-02.wa: We also tend to make assumptions and jump to conclusions based on our fears.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0036-03.wa: Try to ask neutral, clarifying questions that encourage your child to talk, and work to keep your fears to yourself.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0036-04.wa: Nothing stops a conversation with a kid more quickly than focusing on negative things he might get involved with in the future.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0036-05.wa: The future is yet to be created.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0036-06.wa: If you are listening to him with an open heart, it is more likely that his future decisions will take your values into account.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0039-00.wa: Be honest about your level of comfort with particular topics of discussion.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0039-02.wa: Could you give me some more time until I sort through my thoughts and feelings?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0039-04.wa: Addressing sensitive topics for which you still have feelings of anger, grief, regret, or guilt can be tricky.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0039-05.wa: It is fine to say you don't feel ready to talk about certain things because you still have too many emotions to talk about them rationally.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0039-07.wa: Remember, you are human and all humans have to deal with hard emotions at times.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0039-09.wa: Could you write down your questions and give me some time to respond?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0039-10.wa: It might take me awhile, but I want to be honest with you.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0040-00.wa: Kids are listening even when they appear not to be.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0040-01.wa: So, while giving your child positive reinforcement or assuring her of your love may sometimes feel like you're talking to the wind, do it anyway.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0041-01.wa: Even though your preteen might often act as if he doesn't want hugs and kisses, it's a good bet that he still yearns for them.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0041-03.wa: Offer your lap for his pillow while you watch a movie, stroke his back, or throw an arm over his shoulder.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0041-04.wa: Touching is a wonderful way to get close.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0043-02.wa: It is more effective to convey the lessons you've learned from your mistakes than to deny that you've ever made them.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0044.wav: Trust your child to love you, warts and all.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0045.wav: We hope you and the young person you love will have many meaningful and heartfelt conversations based on the suggestions in What Kids REALLY Want to Ask!
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0046-00.wa: The potential for developing intergenerational relationships is growing as human beings live longer.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0046-01.wa: It is becoming increasingly possible for adolescents to know not only their grandparents but also their great-grandparents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0046-02.wa: At the same time, families are more apt to be living far apart from each other as personal preference or opportunities call them away from the place they were raised.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0046-03.wa: While some children live close to grandparents, aunts, uncles, and cousins and hear family lore from several sources, others live far away and have only parents to rely on for information.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0047-00.wa: As your child gains maturity, one of his tasks is to develop a personal identity, a sense of who he is.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0047-01.wa: The extended family, therefore, is especially significant to him.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0047-02.wa: During grade school, his primary parent or parents were all he needed to understand his place in the family, but in middle school he will become more curious about how he fits into the larger family and how the family history has influenced who he is as an individual.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0047-03.wa: A generational connection may help him feel grounded in the knowledge that he is part of a line of individuals with a unique history that includes his ethnic background, class background, and the influence of historic events and significant family incidents on his ancestors.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0048-01.wa: It may also be difficult because often adopted children are cautious about asking questions since they don't want to upset their adoptive parents or appear ungrateful.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0049-00.wa: Several of the questions posed by the children in the research indicated sensitivity to family issues that are not openly discussed.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0049-01.wa: Are there people you don't speak to in your family?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0050-00.wa: You can also decide how much information you're ready to provide and set a clear boundary.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0050-02.wa: They were pretty serious, and someday I'll share more with you.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0050-03.wa: But right now, that's all I want to say.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0050-04.wa: In this case, you could also let him know what you are willing to talk about, so there is no confusion.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0050-05.wa: For example, you may be willing to talk about your early childhood but not your young adult years with a parent or sibling.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0051-00.wa: The purpose of this book is to have conversations with your child that will deepen your understanding and love for each other, providing a solid base of shared knowledge and feelings that will stand you in good stead when she is making stronger and stronger bids for independence in the years to come.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0051-01.wa: Chances are if you trust her with the facts and the history of any discord that exists in the family, she will rise to the occasion of your sharing.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0051-02.wa: It will also empower her to start forming her own understanding of the family dynamics.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0052-00.wa: It is not unusual for children as well as adults in families to feel different levels of affection towards other relatives.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0052-01.wa: There may also be one or more family members with whom a child feels uncomfortable, awkward, or ill at ease due to personality, past behaviors, or lack of familiarity.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0052-02.wa: This chapter and movie discussion will give you a chance to discover if your child would just as soon not have contact with a particular relative.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0052-03.wa: If he doesn't bring that up in your conversation after the movie, you could broach the topic indirectly by talking about a relative you felt uncomfortable around as a child.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0052-04.wa: Was there an uncle who drank too much at family weddings and always wanted to dance with you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0052-05.wa: An aunt who invariably pinched your cheek and asked the same silly question?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0053-00.wa: As young people move into early adolescence, their capacity for future-thinking and imagining various possibilities increases.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0053-01.wa: Some will begin to wonder about who will take care of them if something happens to their parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0053-02.wa: This is another poignant area of conversation that many parents hesitate to address.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0053-03.wa: Yet part of that sense of belonging that children crave includes a reassurance of long-term care and connection.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0054-00.wa: It is especially important for single parents to address the issue and make appropriate arrangements for their children, particularly if there is no second parent in the picture and no one in the extended family lives close by.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0054-01.wa: Talking about the plans you've made may relieve some anxiety.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0054-02.wa: If you don't have a plan, you could ask about her preferences and together figure out who might be the best person to take over her care should the need ever arise.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0056-01.wa: Rifles are a prominent feature of the present-day events.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0056-02.wa: For example, the uncles shoot at traveling salesmen but aim to miss, and no harm is done.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0056-03.wa: They also use their rifles to fish!
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0056-04.wa: In another scene, the uncles and a family with three young children are all pointing rifles into a corn field where the old lion has hidden; they think she is mauling Walter.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0056-05.wa: As Garth tells stories, Walter imagines his uncles in their younger days.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0056-06.wa: In these scenes, Uncle Hub is a swashbuckling swordsman, fighting off attackers, rescuing his brother during a battle, and escaping with his true love on horseback.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0056-07.wa: No one dies, and there is no blood.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0056-10.wa: In the final scenes of the film, viewers learn that the uncles have died in an airplane accident, but the actual crash and dead bodies are not shown.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0057-00.wa: Do you have any relatives that your child doesn't know about?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0057-01.wa: What can you tell him about these relatives?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0057-02.wa: Who is the oldest person in your family?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0057-04.wa: What language did people in your family speak originally?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0058-00.wa: It is safe to say that Uncle Garth and Uncle Hub become Walter's favorite relatives.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0058-01.wa: Do you have a favorite relative?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0058-02.wa: What is it about this relative that makes him or her so special to you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0059-00.wa: Uncle Garth and Uncle Hub had some exciting adventures in their younger years.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0059-01.wa: Have you ever heard a story about something exciting, interesting, or even spooky that one of your relatives did or that happened to them?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0060-01.wa: Who is your most eccentric relative and what makes him or her so interesting and unusual?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0061-00.wa: Uncle Garth and Uncle Hub had lots of money and lots of adventures.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0061-01.wa: Do you have a relative who is wealthy or famous?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0061-02.wa: What about any relatives who struggle with poverty, drug or alcohol addiction, mental illness, or physical disabilities?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0061-03.wa: What do you want your child to know about them, or the struggles they face?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0062-00.wa: Uncle Garth and Uncle Hub find it difficult to talk about their feelings of affection and old love affairs.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0062-01.wa: What issues in your family do you find it hard to talk about?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0063-00.wa: Uncle Garth and Uncle Hub are brothers who obviously share a commitment to each other.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0063-01.wa: Do you have a special brother or sister?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0063-02.wa: What makes you feel close to that sibling?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0063-04.wa: If not, at what stage of your lives did the closeness develop and why?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0063-05.wa: Can you think of a story you can tell your child about an adventure you and a sibling had together when you were teenagers or young adults?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0064-00.wa: Uncle Garth and Uncle Hub have some relatives who are only interested in their money and share no bonds of true affection.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0064-01.wa: Do you have people in your family to whom you are not close?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0064-02.wa: Are there relatives you try to avoid?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-00.wa: Uncle Garth and Uncle Hub die at the end of the movie, and Walter is sad.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-01.wa: Has someone in your family died whom you miss very much?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-02.wa: Were you with the person when they died?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-03.wa: If not, how did you find out?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-04.wa: Was there something you wish you could have said to him or her and didn't?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-05.wa: If you went to the funeral, what happened there and how was that for you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-06.wa: What feelings did you have when this person died?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-07.wa: How did you deal with your feelings?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0065-08.wa: How long did it take to feel better?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0068-00.wa: Here are a few questions to get an interesting conversation going with your parents about people you're related to.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0068-01.wa: If you live with both your parents, Secondhand Lions is a good movie to watch all together so you can hear about both sides of your family, but watch out because it can get really complicated!
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0069-00.wa: Uncle Hub and Uncle Garth soon become Walter's favorite relatives.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0069-01.wa: Who is your favorite relative and why do you like him or her so much?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0071-00.wa: Walter is quite a distance from home at his uncles' place.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0071-01.wa: Have you ever had a chance to stay with a relative who lives far from you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0071-02.wa: Who would you like to stay with and what would you like to do during your stay?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0071-03.wa: Where did your mom or dad spend time with relatives when they were young?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0072-00.wa: Uncle Garth and Uncle Hub were in the French Foreign Legion.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0072-01.wa: Do you know whether any of your relatives were in the military or fought in a war?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0072-02.wa: If not, ask your mom or dad what they know.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0073-00.wa: Walter's uncles turn out to be loving, kind, and caring, but not all relatives are like that.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0073-01.wa: Are there any relatives that you wish you didn't have to see?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0073-02.wa: What is it about them that makes you uncomfortable?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0074-00.wa: Walter decides he'd rather live with his uncles than go back to be with his mother.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0074-01.wa: If something ever happened to your mom and dad, which relative would you like to live with and why?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0075-00.wa: Now it's your turn to write down any questions you would like to ask one or both of your parents about people you're related to.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0075-01.wa: What do you really want to know?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0076-00.wa: Parents and Kids: Collaborate on a list of interview questions for your oldest relative.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0076-01.wa: If possible, plan to record the interview.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0077.wav: What invention that was created in your lifetime has had the greatest impact on your life?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0078.wav: What famous person of your generation do you most admire and why?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0079.wav: What historical event had the greatest impact on your personal life and why?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0080.wav: What decision in your life has had the greatest impact on you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0081-00.wa: Kids: Ask the oldest person in your family to show you any photographs he or she has.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0081-01.wa: Are the photos labeled with names and dates?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0081-02.wa: If not, offer to work with this relative to make sure all the photos are labeled for future generations.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0082-00.wa: Parents and Kids: Uncle Hub has some firm beliefs about things worth believing in: people are basically good; honor, courage, and virtue mean everything; power and money mean nothing; good always triumphs over evil; true love never dies.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0082-01.wa: Spend some time discussing the values and beliefs that are most important to your family.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0082-02.wa: Work together to design a coat of arms that reflects your family values.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0083-00.wa: Kids: Thanks to the Internet, more people are pursuing an interest in genealogy.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0083-01.wa: Is there someone you know who has done genealogical research?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0083-02.wa: If so, ask for a lesson in using his or her favorite genealogy website, and then see if you can find information about one of your ancestors.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0084-00.wa: Kids: Get a large sheet of paper and draw your family tree.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0084-01.wa: Include everyone you know, alive or dead.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0084-02.wa: Make photocopies of any photographs you have and add them to the tree as well.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0084-03.wa: Talk to the oldest person in your family to help fill in any blank spots.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0085.wav: What was your worst experience growing up?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0086.wav: Were you ever pressured as a child, and by whom?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0087.wav: What is your favorite thing to do?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0088.wav: Did you have low self-esteem or high self-esteem when you were my age?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0089.wav: When was the last time you enjoyed yourself?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0090.wav: When you were my age, what bad things did you do with friends?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0091-00.wa: How many illegal things have you done in your life?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0092.wav: What's the stupidest thing you ever did?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0093-01.wa: If so, what are they like?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0094.wav: Have you ever gotten in trouble with the law?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0096-01.wa: If you haven't done so already, start now to create an atmosphere at home in which no topic is taboo, where no question is stupid, and where your own successes and failures as a person are part of the conversation.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0096-03.wa: I've been where you are now and I trust that you will get through this time of many decisions with flying colors.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0096-05.wa: Always resist the impulse to judge, criticize, or lecture.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0096-07.wa: Your child knows alcohol, drugs, and tobacco are bad.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0096-08.wa: What he doesn't know is how to resist the social pressure to use those substances in middle school and high school.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0096-09.wa: They are readily available; if he hasn't been already, he will soon be faced with deciding whether to use them.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0096-10.wa: That's where your experience can be helpful.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0098-00.wa: While reminiscing with your young person about your own teenage years, be sure to include talk about the fun and wholesome experiences you had.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0098-02.wa: What did you most enjoy doing?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0098-03.wa: Who did you love to hang out with?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0098-04.wa: How did you spend your free time in high school?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0098-05.wa: Who were your favorite teachers or other adults with whom you had contact?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0098-06.wa: What extracurricular activities were you involved in?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0098-07.wa: Which of those interests have carried over into your adult life?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0098-08.wa: What kinds of things do you like to do for fun now that you didn't know about then?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0099-00.wa: When you establish a relationship in which trust, honesty, and openness are the norm, your teen will be more likely to come to you to talk about matters with which she is struggling.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0099-02.wa: Hearing about how you decided what was good for you and what wasn't provides her with useful information.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0099-03.wa: She may be able to learn from your example how to size up the risks and benefits of choosing certain actions.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0101-01.wa: What was the biggest influence on your behavior as a teenager?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0101-02.wa: What values did you hold dear?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0101-03.wa: Were you influenced more by your parents' values or by the values of other people or institutions outside the family?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0101-04.wa: What topics were considered taboo in your family?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0101-05.wa: Did that make you more keenly interested in them or less?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0101-06.wa: Did your parents style of parenting push you toward early experimentation with drugs and alcohol, or did it help you avoid these things?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0101-08.wa: On the other hand, democratic parents who provide a consistent and predictable balance between respecting their child as an individual while setting firm and clear boundaries are more successful.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0101-09.wa: This book is all about adopting this style of parenting and developing a close, honest, open relationship in the preteen years that will carry you through your child's adolescence.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0102-00.wa: What if the decisions you made about alcohol, drugs, or tobacco as a teenager led to a life-changing experience like an early pregnancy, a serious car accident, a sexually transmitted disease, years of struggle with an addiction, or even incarceration?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0102-01.wa: You may have spent years coming to grips with decisions you made as a young person.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0102-02.wa: Who better to share that with your teen than you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0102-04.wa: Twelve-step programs are successful because people get to hear real personal experience, not just predictable homilies.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0102-05.wa: You can trust your child to respect your honesty.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0104-00.wa: Most teenagers feel close to their parents, respect their parents judgment, and want to know their parents as individuals.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0104-01.wa: While conflicts between parents and teens typically arise around mundane, day-to-day issues such as chores and homework, middlers will usually follow their parents lead on matters of personal and family values.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0104-02.wa: Sharing your younger self with your preteen the fun and the adventures as well as the mistakes and the regrets offers a powerful way for you to take that lead without alienating your young person.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0107-00.wa: Ferris Bueller goes to elaborate lengths to convince his parents he is ill in order to skip school.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0107-01.wa: Did you ever fake an illness so you wouldn't have to go to school?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0107-04.wa: If you were successful, what did you do on your day off?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0107-05.wa: Did you involve any of your friends?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0108-00.wa: Ferris and his friends do things they know their parents wouldn't approve of, such as skip school and borrow a car without asking.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0108-01.wa: What are some things you did when you were a teenager that you knew your parents wouldn't approve of?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0108-02.wa: What was the worst thing that happened because of that?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0108-03.wa: Can you describe a time when you lied to your parents and got away with it?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0109-01.wa: Several scenes in the movie portray boring teachers and extremely bored students in the classroom.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0109-02.wa: How did you feel about attending high school, especially in your senior year?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0109-03.wa: Were you eager to get on with your independence, or were you content to play by the rules?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0109-04.wa: Who was the most boring teacher in your high school?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0109-05.wa: What made that teacher boring and what methods did you use to get through the class?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0110-00.wa: While Ferris has a strong and confident sense of self, Cameron is full of angst, anger, and trepidation about going along with Ferris and life in general.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0110-01.wa: Of these two characters, which one is more representative of you as a teenager?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0110-02.wa: What can you tell your child about developing self-confidence and self-esteem?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0110-03.wa: When you think about your own self-esteem, are you the same person you were as a teen or different?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0110-05.wa: What parts of yourself as a teenager would you like to reclaim?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0110-06.wa: What parts are still with you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0110-07.wa: What parts are you glad are gone forever?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0111-00.wa: Ferris and his friends have some really fun adventures on their day off, from driving a really cool car to attending a baseball game to joining in a parade.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0111-01.wa: What is your most memorable adventure in or out of school as a teenager?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0111-02.wa: If given the choice, would you go back and relive your teenage years?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0111-04.wa: As an adult, what are some things you like to do for fun?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0112-00.wa: Ferris pressures his best friend, Cameron, to participate in his antics.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0112-01.wa: What kinds of things did you feel pressured to do by other kids when you were a teenager?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0112-02.wa: How did you respond to that pressure?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0112-03.wa: Did you ever do the pressuring, encouraging friends to participate in mischievous behaviors?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0113-01.wa: Did any of the adults in your life ever act out of control or particularly mean?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0114-00.wa: Although alcohol use is not shown or discussed in the movie and drug use is only briefly mentioned, teenagers are interested in their parents early substance use.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0114-01.wa: What can you tell your child about your use of alcohol, drugs, or tobacco as a teenager?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0114-02.wa: What was the most common substance use among students at your high school?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0114-03.wa: Did you feel pressured by peers to drink, smoke, or do drugs?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0115-00.wa: Ferris's sister is really angry with her brother until the very end of the movie when she helps him successfully escape any consequences for his behavior.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0115-01.wa: If you have siblings, were you friends or enemies?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0115-02.wa: Did you help each other, keep secrets and support each other, or ignore each other?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0116-00.wa: Toward the end of the movie, Ferris's sister Jeannie is picked up by the police and taken to the police station for making a phony phone call.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0116-02.wa: As a teenager, did you ever get picked up by the police for something you were doing?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0116-04.wa: What did you learn from that experience?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0118-00.wa: Ferris Bueller's Day Off has been a favorite movie about teenagers since it came out in nineteen eighty six.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0118-01.wa: Ferris Bueller is portrayed as smarter and more clever than the adults around him, while the adults range from naive to out of control.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0118-02.wa: Ferris successfully accomplishes a day off from school by convincing his parents he's sick.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0118-03.wa: Have you ever wondered how your parents were as teenagers?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0119.wav: Here are some questions based on the movie to give you some ideas for things to talk about with your parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0120-00.wa: Ferris lies to his parents and gets away with it, while his sister is treated much differently.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0120-01.wa: If your parent has siblings, who do you think was the more adventurous based on how they are now?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0120-02.wa: Do you think it would have been easy or hard to have siblings like your parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0120-03.wa: What do you know about how well your parents got along with their siblings when they were your age?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0120-04.wa: What do you think they argued about?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0120-05.wa: What adventures do you think they had together?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0121-00.wa: Ferris is so popular at his school that the whole student body seems to know he's sick and some go so far as to take up a collection for him.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0121-01.wa: Do you think your parent was popular in high school or not?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0121-02.wa: Based on what you know about your parent as an adult, which of the following crowds do you think he or she would have belonged to in high school: jocks, brains, nerds, populars, druggies?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0122-00.wa: What did you like most about Ferris Bueller?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0122-01.wa: What did you like least about him?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0122-03.wa: Do you think your mom or your dad as a teenager was more like Ferris, Cameron, or another character in the movie?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0122-04.wa: What are your reasons for thinking this?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0123-00.wa: Cameron expresses a lot of anger towards his father, who seems to care more about his car than Cameron, but Ferris's parents are really attentive and concerned about Ferris.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0123-01.wa: If you know your grandparents, do you think they were more like Ferris's parents or Cameron's dad?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0124-00.wa: Ferris's parents believe he is truly sick, even though he has missed eight previous days of school.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0124-01.wa: How do you think your mom or dad's parents might have handled that?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0125-00.wa: Having fun is Ferris's only concern on his perfect day off, and he seems to have plenty of money.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0125-01.wa: Knowing what you know about your mom or your dad now, how do you think she or he would have spent a day playing hooky from high school if money were no object?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0126-00.wa: The movie ends before we find out what happens when Cameron's father gets home.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0126-01.wa: What do you think would be an appropriate punishment for Cameron?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0126-02.wa: What do you think happened to your mom and dad when their parents caught them doing something they weren't allowed to do?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0126-04.wa: Do you think teens today do similar things?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0127-00.wa: Now it's your turn to write down any questions you would like to ask one or both of your parents about their teenage years.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0128.wav: Kids: Ask your aunts, uncles, and grandparents what they remember about your parents teen years, especially about getting in trouble at school or at home, and then ask your parent what he or she remembers about the same incidents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0129-02.wa: Then plan to do it together!
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0130-01.wa: If fellow students wrote in your yearbook, read through all the comments together.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0130-02.wa: If you kept a personal journal or diary and you still have it, get it out and read through it together.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0132-00.wa: Parents and Kids: Have an ongoing conversation about a sequel to Ferris Bueller's Day Off.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0132-03.wa: Would he still be as self-confident and focused on fun as he was in high school, or would he be different?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0132-06.wa: Would Cameron and Sloane be part of the cast?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0133.wav: Kids: Write a Ferris Bueller's Day Off manifesto explaining why every teenager should be able to take one day off each school year for no reason whatsoever except to have fun.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0134-00.wa: Whether you live in an intact family, a divorced family, or one in which both parents are not present for other reasons, children are curious about their parents early relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0134-01.wa: Discussing this topic with your middler can be complicated, so we have included two movies to help you address the issues in your family.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0134-02.wa: We recommend that you watch Back to the Future to discuss your early relationship with your child's other parent.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0134-03.wa: We have also included Mrs Doubtfire to address the issue of divorce.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0134-04.wa: Use your personal situation to decide whether to watch both movies or just one.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0135-00.wa: Discussion of your relationship with your child's other parent is important for several reasons.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0135-01.wa: It provides the opportunity to fill your child in on the family history that explains her own existence.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0135-02.wa: It also opens the door to conversations about choosing an appropriate mate.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0135-03.wa: As you share details about your own early relationship, you can point out qualities and behaviors that you have learned can lead to success or failure in building a fulfilling long-term union.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0135-04.wa: Discussing this topic can also help your child to notice the ways in which she is similar to or different from each of her parents in terms of whom she is attracted to, or the qualities in another person she might look for as she defines her own identity.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0135-05.wa: And it can help your young person develop a realistic understanding of the importance of compatibility, compromise, and communication for maintaining a loving relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0136-00.wa: Divorce is of particular interest to children in this day and age, both in intact families and divorced ones.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0136-01.wa: It is best to discuss it openly.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0136-02.wa: If your family is intact, any arguments your child overhears between the adults in the household might cause him concern.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0136-03.wa: If divorce is the farthest thing from your mind, this could be a good opportunity to reassure your preteen that despite any difficulties, you are both committed to your relationship and to him.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0136-04.wa: It would help if that message came from each of you individually, as well as being explicitly stated when you are all together.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0136-05.wa: To assist you in discussing the topic of divorce, one of the two movies offered in this chapter deals specifically with that issue.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0136-06.wa: We think this alternate movie will be of particular interest to parents who are no longer in a relationship with their child's other parent.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0137-00.wa: If you are separated or divorced from your child's other parent, your early relationship is still relevant to her life.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0137-01.wa: Opening up the topic of your early relationship with your former partner can become a stepping stone to more honesty in general about what went awry, the choices you made, and how you might have done things differently.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0137-02.wa: It can also lead to great conversations about how personality or value differences can present challenges to a relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0137-03.wa: Being openly self-reflective about your own learning process in relationships can go a long way toward helping her make more informed choices.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0137-04.wa: It is not appropriate to criticize her other parent.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0138-00.wa: If it is too soon to talk about your divorce openly, be explicit about the boundaries of what you are willing to discuss with your preteen at this time, but also leave the door open for future conversations with him when your feelings are more in control.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0138-01.wa: It's important to emphasize that your adolescent was not the cause of any of your difficulties.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0138-02.wa: It is also fine to say you don't feel ready to address certain topics because you still have too many emotions to talk rationally.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0138-05.wa: You might offer to respond to written questions, explaining that you need time to think through your answers.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0138-06.wa: He will appreciate your willingness to communicate and also your human vulnerability.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0138-07.wa: Whatever the situation is in your household, try to convey an atmosphere of openness and honesty.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0140-00.wa: The movie has some brief violence when Libyan terrorists racing through town attack Doc Brown in a parking lot where he is readying his time machine for its maiden voyage.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0140-01.wa: They drive crazily around the parking lot, shooting guns out of the sunroof of their van.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0140-02.wa: Doc Brown is shot in the chest and falls to the ground, but no blood is shown.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0140-04.wa: There is no explicit sex or nudity, although one scene involves a bully manhandling a girl in a car.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0140-05.wa: There is a brief scene that portrays minimal alcohol use, smoking, and reference to reefer.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0140-06.wa: In one scene a teenage boy calls an African-american man a spook.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0141-00.wa: Marty's dad is pretty nervous and has a great deal of trouble asking Marty's mom for a date.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0141-01.wa: Marty's mom seems much more comfortable.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0141-02.wa: Was it easy or difficult for you to ask someone for a date when you were younger?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0141-03.wa: Would you say you were a late bloomer, an early bloomer, or average?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0142-00.wa: Marty's mom and dad meet while they're in high school.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0142-01.wa: How did you meet your preteen's other parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0142-02.wa: Was it a chance encounter that brought you together?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0142-05.wa: Where did you have your first kiss?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0142-06.wa: Did you date for a while before you became more seriously involved?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0142-07.wa: What things did you most enjoy doing together at the beginning of your relationship?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0143-00.wa: Marty's parents hang out at the local burger joint.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0143-01.wa: Where did you like to go when you were first dating?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0143-03.wa: Did your friends support your relationship or discourage it?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0144-00.wa: Marty is growing up in the same town as his parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0144-01.wa: If you live in the same town now, what has changed since you met your partner?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0144-02.wa: If you live in a different town, have you ever gone back to where you met?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0144-03.wa: How does it feel to you now?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0145-00.wa: Marty's mom isn't interested in his dad until his dad defends her against the bully who is harassing her.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0145-01.wa: Did you ever have any doubts about whether or not you should become a committed couple?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0145-02.wa: Was either of you involved with someone else when you met?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0145-03.wa: Were any hearts broken when you became a couple?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0146-00.wa: Marty is worried that if he doesn't intervene, his parents will not get married and have him.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0146-01.wa: Was there ever a point in your relationship where things might have resulted in a vastly different outcome?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0146-02.wa: Is there anything you would change about your early time together as a couple?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0147-00.wa: Marty's parents don't talk much together in their high school encounters.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0147-01.wa: Did you find it easy or difficult to talk to your partner in the early days?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0147-02.wa: Was it hard or easy to express feelings with each other?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0147-03.wa: Has this improved or not over time?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0147-04.wa: What have you learned about communicating more effectively with each other since then?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0149-00.wa: Back to the Future tells a fun story about Marty Mcfly and how he goes back into the past and meets his parents in high school just when they are beginning their relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0149-01.wa: How much do you know about your parents early relationship?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0149-02.wa: Now is the time to ask any questions you have.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0150.wav: To get your creative juices flowing, share your answers to the following questions with your parent or parents and see what they say!
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0151-00.wa: Marty's mom only seemed to notice his dad after his dad defended her against the bully.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0151-01.wa: What do you think your parents liked about each other when they first met?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0152-00.wa: Marty's dad was a pretty weird guy.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0152-01.wa: What do you think your parents found weird about each other when they first met?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0153-00.wa: Marty gets to travel back to the time when his parents were in high school.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0153-01.wa: If you could travel to the time when your parents were younger, when would it be?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0153-02.wa: What would you like to witness in their early relationship together?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0154-00.wa: Marty's parents were in high school when they met.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0154-01.wa: If you could change something about the how, when, or why your parents got together, what would it be?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0155-00.wa: At the beginning of the movie, Marty's parents don't seem very happy, but at the end they have changed dramatically for the better.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0155-01.wa: If you could change something about how your parents are with each other now, what would it be and why?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0156-00.wa: When Back to the Future was made, fewer people got divorced, but now it is common.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0156-01.wa: If your parents are divorced, what do you think caused them to split up?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0156-02.wa: Would you like them to get back together?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0156-04.wa: How does their divorce affect your life?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0157-00.wa: Marty didn't realize how much his involvement in his parents early relationship would change his family.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0157-01.wa: If you could wave a magic wand and have all your dreams come true, what would you change for your parents?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0158-00.wa: Now it's your turn to write down any questions you would like to ask one or both of your parents about their early relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0161-00.wa: Miranda and Daniel divorced after fourteen years of marriage.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0161-01.wa: Were you ever married to your child's other parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0161-02.wa: If so, how long were you married?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0162-00.wa: The children in Mrs Doubtfire learn of their parents decision to divorce by overhearing an argument between Miranda and Daniel.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0162-01.wa: How did your child first learn of your decision to divorce?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0164-00.wa: In the movie, sole custody of the children is awarded to Miranda on the grounds that Daniel has no employment.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0164-01.wa: He is granted visitation with the children every Saturday.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0164-02.wa: What custody and visitation arrangements were made by the court in your situation?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0165-00.wa: Daniel is unhappy with the limited amount of visitation the court awards him and desperately wants to spend more time with his children.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0165-01.wa: How much time does your child spend with her other parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0165-02.wa: Do either you or the other parent actively try to arrange for more time to spend with her?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0167-00.wa: Miranda says she didn't like who she was when she was with Daniel.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0167-01.wa: In what ways does your child's other parent bring out the worst in you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0167-02.wa: What are three positive things you can tell your child about her other parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0168-00.wa: In the movie, Miranda and Daniel get along better when they are apart than they did when they were living together.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0168-01.wa: Are there any ways in which you get along better with your child's parent now than you did when you were together?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0170-00.wa: Mrs Doubtfire tells the story of a divorced dad going to extreme and funny measures to be able to spend time with his children.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0170-01.wa: The subject of divorce is hard for many parents to talk about, and children often have a lot of unanswered questions about why their parents got divorced.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0170-02.wa: Many children feel angry and sad when parents are divorced, but they don't know how to share these feelings with their parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0170-03.wa: There may be a lot of things you wish you knew about your own parents divorce.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0170-04.wa: You may have a lot you wish you could to say to them about how it makes you feel.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0170-05.wa: Now is the time to ask any questions and express any feelings you have.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0171.wav: To get you started, share your answers to the following questions with your parent or parents and see what they say!
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0173-00.wa: What do you think is the reason the parents in the movie got divorced?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0173-01.wa: What do you think is the reason your own parents got divorced?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0174-00.wa: The three children in the movie feel sad and miss their father after he moves out of the house.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0174-01.wa: Can you describe a time when you have missed your other parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0174-02.wa: What do you miss about the parent you don't see as often?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0174-03.wa: When is the last time you felt sad because your parents are divorced?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0175-00.wa: The children in the movie want their parents to get back together.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0175-02.wa: If you could, would you want to get your parents back together?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0175-03.wa: What would be good about that?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0175-04.wa: What would be bad about that?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0176-00.wa: When Mrs Hillard is talking to Mrs Doubtfire about her ex-husband, she begins to say hurtful things about him in front of the children.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0176-01.wa: Has one of your parents ever said critical things to you about your other parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0176-02.wa: If so, what feelings did you have afterwards?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0177-00.wa: At the end of the movie, Mrs Doubtfire replies to a letter from a child whose parents are divorced and offers words of support and advice.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0177-01.wa: If you could talk to other kids whose parents are getting divorced, what advice would you give to help them feel better about the divorce?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0178-00.wa: At the end of the movie, Miranda is ready to set aside her differences with Daniel and do what is best for the children by letting him take care of them every day after school.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0178-01.wa: What differences or disagreements do you wish your parents could set aside?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0179-00.wa: While posing as Mrs Doubtfire, Daniel finds lots of fun activities to do with his children.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0179-01.wa: What are some activities you would like to do with the parent you don't see as often?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0180-00.wa: Now it's your turn to write down any questions you would like to ask one or both of your parents about why they are not together any more.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0181-01.wa: Each adult takes turns telling two truths and a lie about their early relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0181-02.wa: The young people have to guess which statement is the lie.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0181-03.wa: The person who guesses right the most times gets an extra helping of dessert or is excused from after-dinner chores!
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0182-00.wa: Kids: On a large sheet of paper draw a timeline of your parents relationship and interview them for the dates.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0182-01.wa: Be sure to include the date of their first meeting, their first kiss, their decision to become a couple or get married, your birth date and your brothers or sisters birth dates, moves from one house or place to another, changes in jobs, or any other important events from your family's history.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0183-00.wa: Kids: Interview several people to gather more details about your parents early relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0183-01.wa: For example, ask your grandparents or aunts and uncles what they remember about how your parents met.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0184-00.wa: Parents: Show your child pictures of you and your child's other parent around the time you met.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0184-01.wa: Write a short description of each picture including when and where it was taken.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0185-01.wa: Make it as funny as possible!
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0187.wav: Why am I not anything like my Mom?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0189.wav: What really happened when I was born?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0190.wav: What was I like when I was a baby?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0191.wav: Why did you pick my name?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0192.wav: Was there anything wrong with me when I was born?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0193.wav: How happy were you when I was born?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0194.wav: Did you want me to be a boy, or a girl?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0195.wav: Did you want to have me?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0197-00.wa: What is the earliest memory you have of yourself?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0197-01.wa: Do you recall anything from when you were an infant or toddler?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0197-02.wa: Have you heard stories or seen photographs of yourself as a young child?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0197-03.wa: Most of us want to have a sense of our personal history; we want to know our own life story, including where we came from and how we got to where we are.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0197-04.wa: It is often during early adolescence that this curiosity about our early life first emerges.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0197-05.wa: The rapid and remarkable physical changes during puberty may prompt a middler to begin wondering how she looked as a baby and notice ways she is similar to or different from her parents, siblings, and other relatives.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0197-07.wa: Imagining how things might now be different if her childhood had been different is also possible during these years.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0197-08.wa: She is likely to conjure many questions about her early life in order to fill in any missing pieces and gain insight into how she has come to be the person she is today.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0199-00.wa: One question that emerges for some young adolescents is whether or not they are adopted.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0199-01.wa: In the research, a total of nine boys and girls asked about this.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0199-02.wa: When your biological child poses this question, it may not mean she truly believes she is adopted, but adoption may offer a plausible explanation for any differences between you that are especially problematic.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0199-03.wa: Bringing this out into the open could be helpful in discovering the ways she feels alienated and how you can begin to address the situation.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0201-00.wa: Hopefully, you have carefully laid the groundwork in your child's earlier years by speaking openly and frequently about her adoption so that she has integrated that reality into her concept of self and knows that talking about this with you at any time is perfectly okay.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0201-01.wa: If you haven't done this, now is an excellent time to start.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0201-02.wa: Reading this chapter and watching this movie together may help.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0203-00.wa: Early adolescence is the time when adopted children start fantasizing about birth parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0203-03.wa: And then offering any facts you know about them might help with the assimilation process.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0203-05.wa: One idea to ease this is to engage with her in activities that she finds interesting, especially if they are different from what you might choose.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0203-06.wa: For example, you may encourage her to select an activity once a month in which the rest of the family participates or ask for her input to make holidays special for her.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0203-07.wa: This is good advice to encourage and support the uniqueness of biological children as well.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0204-00.wa: Perhaps you are one of the approximately eight hundred thousand grandparents who are raising a grandchild without the presence or assistance of the parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0204-01.wa: Similar to adopting a child from a family you don't know, talking openly and in a positive manner about the circumstances that led to this reality will let your grandchild know it is okay to ask questions about his beginnings and can help him find some missing pieces in his search for his identity.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0204-02.wa: If the circumstances around your grandchild being placed with you are unfortunate, then you will want to tell him what you can while still allowing him to honor and respect his birth parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0204-03.wa: There may be some truths that would be too difficult for him to hear, truths about early mistreatment or even abandonment by his parent.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0204-04.wa: It's not necessary to tell him things that would cause him to see his birth parents in a negative light.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0204-05.wa: Rather than dwelling on the reasons he was taken away from or given up by his birth parents, focus on the message that you are committed to him and that you're happy he's with you now.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0205-00.wa: The movie for this chapter also provides an opportunity to acknowledge the significance of gender as an influence in your child's early upbringing.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0205-01.wa: She will be interested in knowing how your preparations for her and her early years were shaped by gender expectations.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0205-02.wa: For instance, did you choose clothing and blankets that were pink to represent a girl, or did you select gender-neutral colors for her like yellow and green?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0205-05.wa: From a very early age parents and other caregivers have different expectations about what it means to be a boy or a girl and may treat their children accordingly.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0205-06.wa: For example, rough and tumble play may be tolerated or even encouraged in sons but not daughters; crying may be approved of in girls but not boys.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0205-07.wa: What do you think and how do you feel about these issues related to gender, and what can you share about them with your child?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0206-00.wa: Kids in early adolescence tend to be very much aware of gender and the associated expectations.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0206-01.wa: The physical changes of puberty accentuate the basic biological differences between boys and girls.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0206-03.wa: Gender role expectations also are reflected in middlers' behavior.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0206-04.wa: There may be differential treatment of boys and girls in the home.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0206-05.wa: Chores may be assigned based on gender, with boys doing outside jobs such as washing cars or mowing the lawn and girls helping inside with laundry and dishes.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0206-06.wa: Children may wonder whether parents would have preferred another gender.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0206-07.wa: They may be concerned about or frustrated by the fact that certain opportunities are more or less available to them depending on their gender.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0207-00.wa: There is a wealth of interesting and profound information to share with your child having to do with her arrival in your family.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0207-01.wa: Nothing is more interesting than our own stories about how we came to be.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0209-00.wa: Filmed in New Zealand, Whale Rider tells the story of a young Maori girl named Paikea, who is being raised by her paternal grandparents after her mother and twin brother died during childbirth.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0209-01.wa: Paikea believes she is destined to become the next leader of her people.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0209-02.wa: According to legend, the first leader of the Ngati Konohi tribe arrived on the back of a whale over a thousand years ago, and since that time every subsequent leader has been a firstborn male.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0209-03.wa: Paikea's grandfather Koro, who is to choose the next leader, is bound by tradition and patriarchy, and he resists his granddaughter's wishes to be trained in the warrior ways and customs of her people.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0209-04.wa: With determination and strength, Paikea fights to prove her worthiness to her grandfather and to claim her destiny as the next whale rider.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0211-00.wa: Whale Rider opens with a scene of a mother giving birth.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0211-01.wa: What can you tell your child about the circumstances of his birth?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0211-02.wa: For example, what time of the day or night did labor begin?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0211-03.wa: What were you doing at the time?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0211-04.wa: If you went to a hospital, what made you decide it was time?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0211-05.wa: If you had your child at home, did a midwife attend the birth?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0211-06.wa: If so, at what point did she arrive?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0211-08.wa: Who were the first people you called when he was born?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0212-00.wa: Paikea's mother and newborn twin brother both die in childbirth.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0212-01.wa: Were there any medical complications surrounding your middler's birth?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0212-02.wa: What can you tell your child about this?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0212-03.wa: Was your child born with any special conditions or concerns?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0213-00.wa: When Paikea is born, everyone in the family is waiting for a firstborn boy.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0213-01.wa: Her grandfather Koro in particular is disappointed that she is a girl.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0213-02.wa: Prior to your middler's birth, how important was it to you that you have a boy or a girl in particular?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0213-03.wa: If you had a preference, which were you hoping for: a boy, or a girl?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0214-00.wa: Paikea's mother dies in childbirth, and her father is too emotionally distraught to take care of her, so she is being raised by her grandparents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0214-01.wa: If your middler is adopted, what can you tell him about the circumstances through which he came to be your child?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0215-00.wa: Shortly after Paikea is born, her uncle and grandparents arrive at the hospital to see her.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0215-01.wa: Who was present when your young person was born or arrived in your family?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0215-02.wa: What family members and friends made visits to welcome her after her arrival?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0215-03.wa: What gifts did you receive for her?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0216-00.wa: Paikea's father is very happy about her birth but also is devastated at the loss of his wife and his newborn infant son.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0216-01.wa: What emotions did you feel at the time of your young person's birth or his arrival in your home?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0216-02.wa: What made you especially happy at that time?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0216-03.wa: How did you celebrate his arrival?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0216-04.wa: What, if anything, made you sad or worried?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0217-00.wa: Paikea's father names her after the legendary ancient tribal leader.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0217-01.wa: Is there any special significance to the name you chose for your middler?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0217-02.wa: How did you choose that name?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0217-03.wa: What other names might you have chosen?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0217-04.wa: If someone else was involved in choosing a name, were you in complete agreement or not?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0217-05.wa: Does the name have any family significance?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0218-00.wa: As a young girl, Paikea loves spending time with her grandfather Koro, riding on his bicycle handle bars, talking to him about the legends of their people.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0218-02.wa: What was your middler like when she was a child?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0218-03.wa: What were some of her favorite activities?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0218-04.wa: Who did she enjoy playing with and spending time with?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0218-06.wa: Can you recall any particularly funny moments during her early years?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0218-07.wa: Was there a talent or a personality characteristic that you noticed early in her life that has developed over time?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0218-08.wa: Did you ever have a sense of destiny for this child?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0223-00.wa: Paikea's grandfather is loyal to the tribal traditions of his people.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0223-01.wa: What are some family traditions that your parents and grandparents have passed on to you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0223-02.wa: What are some unique things your family does to celebrate holidays or birthdays that have special meaning to you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0224-00.wa: When Paikea's father comes to visit, he asks her to consider moving to Germany and staying with him.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0224-02.wa: She considers her home to be on the land where she was born, with her grandparents, who have raised her.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0224-03.wa: Where do you think of as your home?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0224-05.wa: Who is there who makes you feel loved?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0224-06.wa: If you have a birth parent who has not raised you, are there some things you would like to know about that parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0224-07.wa: What questions would you like to ask her or him about the reasons you live with your adoptive family?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0224-08.wa: What thoughts or feelings do you have about meeting that parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0225-00.wa: Paikea is a brave and determined young girl.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0225-01.wa: At the end of the movie she plays a key role in saving the beached whales when she rides one out into the open ocean.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0225-02.wa: What stories have you heard from parents or other relatives about brave or unexpected things you did when you were a child?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0225-03.wa: What have you heard from your parents about what you were like as a small child?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0226-00.wa: Paikea's mother died while giving birth to her, and Paikea is being raised by her grandparents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0226-01.wa: What do you know about your own birth?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0226-02.wa: On what day of the week were you born?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0226-05.wa: Have you been raised by the mother who gave birth to you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0226-06.wa: If you lost a parent at a young age, what do you know about that parent?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0226-07.wa: What would you like to know?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0227-00.wa: In her speech at the school concert, Paikea speaks of her deep love and respect for her grandfather.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0227-01.wa: She also acknowledges that she wasn't what her grandfather was expecting and that by being born, she broke the line back to the ancient ones.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0227-02.wa: In what ways do you feel like you are not what your parents or grandparents were expecting?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0227-03.wa: In what ways do you think you are more than what they were expecting?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0228-00.wa: Paikea has special insights and personal qualities that make her able to serve as a new leader and prophet for her people.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0228-01.wa: What special qualities do you have that make you unique?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0228-03.wa: What kinds of people and activities are you drawn to?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0229-00.wa: Now it's your turn to write down any questions you would like to ask one or both of your parents about how you came to be their child and what makes you special to them.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0230-00.wa: Parents: If you have a baby book that you kept during your child's infancy, pull it out and share it with your child.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0230-01.wa: If you don't have a book, consider starting a memory journal.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0230-02.wa: Write down what you remember about milestones in your child's first few years of life.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0230-03.wa: For example, who was the first relative who held her after she was born, what was her first word, when did she take her first steps, how did you celebrate her first birthday?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0231-00.wa: Parents and Kids: Together, look through the family photo album.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0231-01.wa: Kids, pick out six photos that were taken when you were a baby.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0231-02.wa: Parents, for each picture tell your child the story that goes with the photo when the photo was taken, where you were, who was there, what you were doing, how old he was, what time of year it was, and so on.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0233-00.wa: Parents and Kids: Separately write two lists.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0233-02.wa: Show your lists to each other.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0233-03.wa: What are some things you agree on?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0233-04.wa: What are some things you disagree about?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0234-00.wa: Parents of adopted children: If you haven't done so already, start developing a library of books for your child on the adoption experience, and let him or her know where the books are located and the information they contain.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0234-01.wa: Ask your local librarian for help to find both fiction and nonfiction books that speak to both the facts and emotions of adoption.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0235.wav: Do you love me and would you ever give me up?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0237.wav: What do you really think of me?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0239.wav: If I get in trouble any time, will you tell me so I can correct my mistakes?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0240.wav: Why do you break me down inside and hurt me outside all the time?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0241.wav: Why don't you have any time for me?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0243.wav: Why don't parents talk openly with children if we talk openly with them?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0244.wav: Can I fall back to you if I have a problem?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0245-00.wa: As your child moves into the preteen years, you may begin to notice some changes in your relationship with him.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0245-01.wa: Do you find that you're spending less time in shared activities?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0245-02.wa: Does it seem as though he would rather talk to his friends than you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0245-03.wa: Is he embarrassed if you try to kiss or hug him in front of other people?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0245-04.wa: Are there days when it seems like whatever you say is the wrong thing?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0245-06.wa: All of these are typical of the changing relationship between parent and child during the middle-school years.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0245-07.wa: Closeness decreases as parents and children spend less time together and kids choose to confide in friends more than in parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0245-08.wa: Conflict increases as kids develop new reasoning skills that enable them to question their parents rules and expectations.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0246-00.wa: It is likely that your middler also has noticed these changes in your relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0246-01.wa: The largest percentage and the most poignant questions kids asked in response to our research were about their relationship with their parents.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0246-02.wa: Kids this age want to know how their parents feel about them.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0246-03.wa: They want to feel accepted by their parents and to be able to talk about problems and issues in their lives.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0246-04.wa: They're unhappy about having arguments with their parents, and they want to understand why some of those conflicts can turn so hurtful.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0246-05.wa: This chapter offers you the chance to reflect on the relationship between you and your young person, acknowledge any areas of concern that you may want to tend to, and celebrate the love you share.
