./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0247-00.wa: Human beings have an inherent need for acceptance.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0247-01.wa: For most individuals the first and primary source of acceptance is the parent.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0247-02.wa: Parents convey their acceptance in many different ways, for example, with their affection, care, comfort, concern, nurturance, support, and love.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0247-03.wa: The expression of acceptance can be physical, verbal, or symbolic, but of primary importance is that it be reliable, consistent, and unconditional.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0247-04.wa: More simply put, all children need to have at least one person who is absolutely head-over-heels crazy about them all the time and no matter what.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0247-05.wa: Ideally that person is a parent.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0248-00.wa: When kids are infants and young children, most parents find it easy to feel affection towards them.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0248-01.wa: Looking at their sweet faces while they're sleeping, or seeing them cry when they're upset pulls at our heartstrings.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0248-02.wa: But as kids move into the preteen years, what came so easily before may now seem complicated.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0248-03.wa: It can be difficult to look at a sulking preteen and feel an urge to hug her, or see the mess on her bedroom floor and be overcome with affection towards her.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0248-04.wa: However, parents need to keep expressing love to their kids even when it seems nearly impossible to do.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0249-00.wa: Expressing affection is also so much easier with infants and young children compared to middlers.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0249-01.wa: You can hold them, kiss them, sing to them, play with them.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0249-02.wa: But when a child is in early adolescence, ways to express parental affection and acceptance may not be as obvious as they once were.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0249-04.wa: But none of that means he no longer needs or wants your love and acceptance.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0249-05.wa: It just means that you have to find new ways to express love and care.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0249-06.wa: Expressions of love may become more symbolic, like setting rules to protect him from people or situations that might be dangerous, preparing his favorite breakfast on the day of a big math test, or sitting in the rain to watch him play a soccer game.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0250-00.wa: One of the most loving things you can do for your young person is to be available to listen and offer support when she has a problem.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0250-01.wa: While she may confide in friends about some of her social issues, she will take comfort in having a parent as a soft place to land when she has upsets that friends can't help her with.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0250-03.wa: As trivial as some of those issues may seem to you as an adult, it's important to treat them as the meaningful concerns they are to your child.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0250-04.wa: If you can respond with empathy and genuine concern to the small matters, she will be more likely to seek you out for help with any bigger, more serious matters that arise.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-00.wa: Of course, there will also be many moments of happiness and joy in the life of your young adolescent.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-01.wa: You can also show your love by sharing in his happiness and celebrating his successes.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-02.wa: Setting aside time every day to hear about what's going on in his life lets him know you care.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-03.wa: For many families this time might be the dinner hour.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-04.wa: For others, it might be the last thirty minutes before bedtime or during the drive to school or other activities.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-05.wa: Do you spend time talking with your middler every day?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-06.wa: Do you know what's going on in his life?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-08.wa: In fact, you might want to refer to those pages every few weeks just to be sure you're doing everything you can to communicate your acceptance, support, and concern for your young person.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0251-09.wa: Building a strong foundation now will pay big dividends in a few short years.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0252-00.wa: The movie for this chapter illustrates what can happen in the absence of parental acceptance.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0252-01.wa: Believing that parents do not really love or care about her can result in a host of psychological and social complications for a child.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0252-02.wa: Personal insecurity, anxiety, anger, resentment, and depression all have been attributed to the absence of parental acceptance.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0252-03.wa: If an individual feels her parents don't love her, she may in turn come to view herself as unlovable.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0252-04.wa: She may close off emotionally and have difficulty expressing and receiving love.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0252-05.wa: She may adopt a defensive approach in social relationships, expecting the worst from people and perceiving hostility where none is intended.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-00.wa: Most experts agree it's not the absence of affection per se, but rather the individual's perception of parental rejection that can be so devastating.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-01.wa: So even if you think you're doing things to express your love and acceptance to your child, it's not how the message is sent, but how it is received that matters.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-02.wa: If you think you're expressing your love and acceptance to your child but he responds negatively, try asking him for feedback.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-04.wa: What could I do that would work better for you?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-05.wa: It also might be helpful to ask someone who is privy to your private interactions to give you some objective feedback.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-06.wa: What you think of as loving might really be transmitting an unloving message.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-07.wa: For example, parents who seek to control a child may unintentionally project the message that he is untrustworthy or unable to handle things for himself.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-08.wa: Spend some time reflecting on the messages you give your child in both words and deeds.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-09.wa: What do you do to tell your middler you love him?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-10.wa: Does he know that you think he is important?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0253-12.wa: How do you rate on this scale?
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0254-00.wa: Conflicts and disagreements are bound to arise in any close relationship.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0254-01.wa: The parent-child relationship during early adolescence is particularly vulnerable because kids have more advanced abilities to question their parents rules and decisions and greater interest in spending time with friends away from parental control.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0254-03.wa: The thing to be concerned about is not whether you argue, but how you argue.
./datasets/nancy/audio/WKRWTA-0257-01.wa: Kids may not act like they want hugs and kisses from you, but they do.
